What is the penalty the coercer can inflict on a player who refuses to act in accordance with the character's wishes?
One penalty die on one dice roll (of the coercer’s choice) made by the player of the coerced investigator.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What happens to an insane investigator who fails a pushed roll?
He or she holds on for dear life and screams at the top of their lungs for as long as they can.

No, only one penalty die can be held by one character against any other character at a time.

What are the consequences of failing a pushed roll in the game?
The consequences of failing a pushed roll include accidentally erasing files, corrupting the system, leaving evidence, alerting others, or infesting the computer/network with a virus.

What does a high Credit Rating indicate in the game?
A high Credit Rating indicates how prosperous and financially confident the investigator appears to be.
